page.title: 19KIRKCALDY HARBOUR
page.content: Kirkcaldy harbour was owned by the town council until 1968. The dock in its present form was built in 1909. Mr. Bayliss is the harbour master at Kirkcaldy, Methil and Burntisland harbours. The dock is 280 feet long and 18 feet deep. The harbour belongs to the Forth Ports Authority. The dock holds between five and six ships. About 400 ships used to dock there annually. Now the number is between 70 and 100. The imports are wheat and barley for Hutchison's flour mill. Malt is made from the barley and is sent to the Orkneys. Scrap metal is exported to Spain and other countries. The weighbridge can take a weight of 50 tonnes. The harbour business is declining because of improved road transport and fewer ships being available.
